list_definition.definition: a tall pointed stone pillar which has been built in memory of a person or an event

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The obelisk was initially erected by the Pharaoh Rameses II in Heliopolis.

list_ex_of_english: The listing designation includes the parapets, lamps, obelisks and the approach walls.

Other obelisks show figures completely naked and usually only their head is covered, and legs are shod.
His sacred obelisk towered over the arena, set in the central barrier, close to his temple and the finishing line.
It was topped by a balustrade, with four obelisks on corner plinths.
I am sure that most people do not know about the obelisk.
